title: Songs IX
text:
Lady of Silence
from the winsome cage of
thy body
rose
     through the sensible
night
a
quick bird

(tenderly upon
the dark’s prodigious face
thy
voice
      scattering perfume-gifted
wings
suddenly escorts
with feet
sun-sheer

the smarting beauty of dawn)
seo_description: A poem by E. E. Cummings in “XLI Poems”
